column4: Hi, I have a massive problem: when I open my home folder with nautilus, the window opens, but the files/folders in it are not to be seen, just an empty space in the window. You have to kill this window to close it. After a few minutes, I have an intense disk activity and have to restart X, cause it hangs then. Reboot didnt help. Other nautilus windows react normally. Please help
what the hell you got in there?
can you do an ls in a terminal?
nothing special..
yes
how many files?
ls -la | wc -l
99 files
hmm ... are any of them images?  that is not a terrible thought from Ali .. could be something to do with trying to generate a thumbnail?
mind you it does thumbnails for lots of things
like pdfs, etc.  Perhaps you can get into list view first then go there and see if it is better behaved?
oh no that doesnt work, views are per folder ... it might be a setting?
yes - Edit, Preferences and its there
theres no image or media file in it
i would try changing pref to list view and see if it helps ... just to eliminate the possibility
and because i dont have any better ideas!
ok, Ill try
hmm ... ok so now it is a question of what is the culprit.
you could try moving half the files somewhere else and keep doing half again and find the culprit(s) by process of elimination?
or it could be that there is something wrong with thumbnail generation on your machine, period
or perhaps this is enough of a fix?
so it is something other than thumbnails about icon view??  Odd.
